unnormalised: **Education Technology: Adaptive Learning Gains Traction in India**
normalised: **Education Technology: Adaptive Learning Gains Traction in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26 – Adaptive learning platforms are rapidly transforming India's education landscape, offering personalized learning experiences tailored to individual student needs. A recent report indicates a 40% increase in the adoption of such technologies in Indian schools over the past year, particularly in states like Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six – Adaptive learning platforms are rapidly transforming India's education landscape, offering personalized learning experiences tailored to individual student needs. A recent report indicates a forty percent increase in the adoption of such technologies in Indian schools over the past year, particularly in states like Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu.

unnormalised: IIT Bombay is piloting a program using adaptive learning to improve student performance in core engineering subjects. These systems analyze student responses in real-time and adjust the difficulty level accordingly, addressing knowledge gaps more effectively than traditional teaching methods.
normalised: I I T Bombay is piloting a program using adaptive learning to improve student performance in core engineering subjects. unnormalised: Echoing the Bollywood film "3 Idiots," which championed individualized learning, educators believe adaptive learning can help students grasp concepts at their own pace, fostering a deeper understanding. Preliminary results show significant improvements in standardized test scores, with students demonstrating a 15-20% gain in specific subjects. The Ministry of Education is exploring options to integrate adaptive learning tools across various levels of the Indian education system, aiming to make quality education accessible to all, regardless of geographical location or socio-economic background. Future studies will assess the long-term impact and scalability of these initiatives.
